newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian peso dips in "boring" session.
newsitem.headline: Colombian peso dips in "boring" session.

text.p: Colombia's peso dipped 0.6 of a peso to 1,062.3 against the dollar in another session that failed to shake off the post-Easter cobwebs, interbank traders said.

"The market was slightly more lively than previous days, but there wasn't much trading and the session was boring," one trader said. Dollar inflows from coffee and foreign investment were quickly mopped up demand, he added.

Traders reported 278 deals worth a total $109 million, below the daily average of about $180 million. The peso hit an intraday high of 1,061.2 and sank to an intraday low of 1,062.9. ((--Juan Guillermo Londono, Bogota newsroom, 571 610 7944))
